derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin immortalis, from in- 'not' + mortalis (see mortal)

entry.def: Someone or something that is immortal is famous and likely to be remembered for a long time.

example.ex: ...Wuthering Heights, Emily Bronte's immortal love story...
example.tran: 《呼啸山庄》，艾米莉·勃朗特不朽的爱情小说

entry.def: Someone or something that is immortal will live or last for ever and never die or be destroyed.

example.ex: The pharaohs were considered gods and therefore immortal.
example.tran: 法老们被视为神灵，且长生不死。

entry.def: If you refer to someone's immortal words, you mean that what they said is well-known, and you are usually about to quote it.

example.ex: ...Roosevelt's immortal words, 'Speak softly and carry a big stick.'
example.tran: 罗斯福的不朽名言——“说话温和,手持大棒”

example.ex: I keep remembering Hannah Pakula's immortal line: 'Hollywood is no place for a woman over forty with a library card.'
example.tran: 我一直谨记汉娜·帕库拉的名言：“好莱坞不是年过四十手拿图书证的女人呆的地方。”

means.word_mean: 1. a person (such as an author) of enduring fame;
2. any supernatural being worshipped as controlling some part of the world or some aspect of life or who is the personification of a force

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"向内,成为,进入,使……"; 2. 表示"不,无,非"

stems_affixes.word_buile: im向内,成为,进入,使……+passion激情+ed……的→adj.慷慨激昂的
im向内,成为,进入,使……+plic重叠+it→进入重叠→不直说→储蓄的
im不,无,非+moral道德的→adj.不道德的
im不,无,非+partial有偏见的→adj.公平的
im不,无,非+pecc斑点+able……的→无斑点的
im不,无,非+possible可能的→adj.不可能的
im向内,成为,进入,使……+migrate移居→入住
im向内,成为,进入,使……+pel推→推进,驱动
im向内,成为,进入,使……+peril危险→v.使处于危险中
im向内,成为,进入,使……+person人+ate表动词→进入别人→扮演别人
im向内,成为,进入,使……+prison监狱→v.监禁
im向内,成为,进入,使……+pulse跳动→内在推动→冲动

sentences.en: Someone believed that the soul is immortal.

means.word_mean: 不朽的人物；名垂千古的人物

sentences.en: Shakespeare is one of the immortals.
sentences.cn: 莎士比亚是不朽的人物之一。

jushi.english: The play contained one immortal line.
jushi.chinese: 剧本中有一句不朽的名言。

jushi.english: Nobody believes in the myth about human beings becoming immortals.
jushi.chinese: 谁也不相信人能成仙的神话。
